intro: Verbascum akhalkalakiense, commonly known as the Georgian mullein, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Georgia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
